title: Apple Music, Apple TV+, Apple One Now Cost More; The tech giant is increasing prices for subscriptions by $1 to $2 a month starting Monday
text:
Apple One, which bundles Apple Music, Apple TV+ and other services, will now cost $2 more a month at $16.95. Apple One's family plan, which allows account sharing, will rise to $22.95 a month from $19.95.

The iPhone maker's streaming business is part of its plan to grow its services business, which brought in nearly a quarter of all its sales in its fiscal third-quarter. Apple is scheduled to release its latest quarterly results on Thursday.

The company said Apple Music's price increase is due to the rising cost of licensing music. It said the new price for Apple TV+ reflects the bigger selection of shows and movies it currently has compared with when it launched three years ago.

"CODA," a movie Apple TV+ released last year, won the best picture Oscar in Marchâ€”the first such win for a streaming service. Last month, its show "Ted Lasso" won the Emmy Award for outstanding comedy series.

Other companies have been raising subscription fees amid rising costs for making new shows. Streaming site Netflix Inc. increased its prices earlier this year for the first time since 2020.

And Amazon.com Inc., citing rising shipping and labor costs, raised the price of its Prime membership, which includes free shipping, streaming services and other perks.

Write to Joseph Pisani at joseph.pisani@wsj.com
